intro: Primula sonchifolia subsp. sonchifolia, commonly known as the common primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of oval, dark green leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its botanical features include a taproot system and hairy stems, which help it survive in cooler climates.
